context: The <a4_0>history of the Greek people is closely associated with the history of <b9_0>Greece, Cyprus, Constantinople, Asia Minor and the Black Sea<b9_0/>.<a4_0/> During the <a0_0><b5_0>Ottoman rule of Greece<b5_0/><a0_0/>, a number of Greek enclaves around the Mediterranean were cut off from the core, notably in Southern Italy, the Caucasus, Syria and Egypt. <a3_0>By the early 20th century, <b8_0>over half of the overall Greek-speaking population was settled in <a1_0><b6_0>Asia Minor<b8_0/><b6_0/> (now Turkey)<a3_0/><a1_0/>, while later that century <a2_0>a <b7_0>huge wave of migration to the United States, Australia, Canada and elsewhere created the modern Greek diaspora<b7_0/>.
